question_text_raw:
News about politics and current affairs, watching, reading or listening, in minutes
ASK ALL
On a typical day, about how much time do you spend watching, reading or listening to news about politics and current affairs?
Please give your answer in hours and minutes. 
INTERVIEWER: If no time spent, enter 00 00. 
TYPE IN DURATION
question_cleaned: On a typical day, about how much time do you spend watching, reading, or listening to news about politics and current affairs? Please give your answer in hours and minutes.
notes: Removed interviewer instructions and data-entry notes. Respondents' answers recorded as duration in hours and minutes (HH MM); 00 00 indicates no time spent. Kept original special codes for missing values.

question_text_raw:
Internet use, how often
CARD 1
People can use the internet on different devices such as computers, tablets and smartphones. How often do you use the internet on these or any other devices, whether for work or personal use?
question_cleaned: How often do you use the internet on any device, for work or personal use?
notes: Removed 'CARD 1' and the explanatory device examples; reworded as a direct question. No changes to response categories.

question_text_raw:
Internet use, how much time on typical day, in minutes
ASK IF MOST DAYS OR EVERY DAY AT A2 (IF A2 = 4, 5)
On a typical day, about how much time do you spend using the internet on a computer, tablet, smartphone or other device, whether for work or personal use?
Please give your answer in hours and minutes. 
INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION
question_cleaned: On a typical day, how much time do you spend using the internet on any device (computer, tablet, smartphone), for work or personal use? Please answer in hours and minutes.
notes: Removed routing ('ASK IF...') and interviewer instruction ('INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION'). Rephrased for clarity. Only special/missing codes were provided; numeric duration responses are not included in the mapping.

question_text_raw:
Most people can be trusted or you can't be too careful
ASK ALL 
CARD 2
Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people? Please tell me on a score of 0 to 10, where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means that most people can be trusted.
question_cleaned: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people? Please answer on a scale from 0 to 10, where 0 means "you can't be too careful" and 10 means "most people can be trusted."
notes: Removed card/interviewer instructions. Collapsed original 0–10 scale into 5 categories (0–1, 2–3, 4–6, 7–8, 9–10); preserved original endpoint wording for extremes and retained special codes.

question_text_raw:
Allowed to decide how daily work is organised
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1) 
CARD 48
I am going to read out a list of things about your working life. Using this card, please say how much the management at your work {allows/allowed} you... ...to decide how your own daily work {is/was} organised?
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: How much does or did management at your workplace allow you to decide how your daily work is organised?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer notes. Reworded to cover past or present employment ('does or did'). Collapsed 11-point (0–10) scale into 5 categories: 0-1 No influence; 2-3 Little influence; 4-6 Some influence; 7-8 High influence; 9-10 Complete control. Simplified special-code labels (removed asterisks).

question_text_raw:
Allowed to influence policy decisions about activities of organisation
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1) 
CARD 48
I am going to read out a list of things about your working life. Using this card, please say how much the management at your work {allows/allowed} you... ...to influence policy decisions about the activities of the organisation?
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: How much does or did management at your workplace allow you to influence policy decisions about the organisation's activities?
notes: Removed routing, card and interviewer instructions; preserved core meaning. Collapsed 11-point (0–10) scale into 5 categories (0-1, 2-3, 4-6, 7-8, 9-10). Simplified special missing-value labels.

question_text_raw:
Total contracted hours per week in main job overtime excluded

Acceptable range of responses is between 0 and 168 hours.

question_text_raw:
Paid work in another country, period more than 6 months last 10 years
In the last 10 years have you done any paid work in another country for a period of 6 months or more?

notes: Removed redundant header text and rephrased as a natural question. Removed asterisks from special-value labels while preserving all original codes.

question_text_raw:
Ever unemployed and seeking work for a period more than three months
ASK ALL
Have you ever been unemployed and seeking work for a period of more than three months?
question_cleaned: Have you ever been unemployed and seeking work for more than three months?
notes: Removed survey instruction 'ASK ALL' and rephrased slightly; removed asterisks from missing-value labels.

question_text_raw:
Any period of unemployment and work seeking lasted 12 months or more
ASK IF YES AT F36 (IF F36 = 1)
Have any of these periods lasted for 12 months or more?
question_cleaned: Have any periods of unemployment and job-seeking lasted 12 months or more?
notes: Removed routing instruction ('ASK IF YES AT F36') and rephrased for clarity. Removed asterisks from special-value labels.

question_text_raw:
Any period of unemployment and work seeking within last 5 years
Have any of these periods been within the past 5 years?
INTERVIEWER: 'These periods' refer to the periods of more than 3 months at F36
question_cleaned: Have you had any periods of unemployment and job-seeking lasting more than three months within the past five years?
notes: Removed interviewer instruction and card reference; clarified that 'these periods' refers to unemployment spells longer than three months and rephrased into a direct question.

Member of trade union or similar organisation
ASK ALL
Are you or have you ever been a member of a trade union or similar organisation? IF YES, is that currently or previously?
question_cleaned: Are you or have you ever been a member of a trade union or similar organisation? If yes, is that current or past membership?
notes: Removed 'ASK ALL' and conditional survey wording; rephrased into conversational form. Removed asterisks from special-code labels.

question_text_raw:
Main source of household income
CARD 50
Please consider the income of all household members and any income which may be received by the household as a whole. What is the main source of income in your household?
Please use this card.

question_text_raw:
Household's total net income, all sources
CARD 51
Using this card, please tell me which letter describes your household's total income, after tax and compulsory deductions, from all sources? If you don't know the exact figure, please give an estimate. Use the part of the card that you know best: weekly, monthly or annual income.
question_cleaned: Which letter best describes your household's total income from all sources, after tax and compulsory deductions? If you don't know the exact figure, please give an estimate and use the period you know best (weekly, monthly, or annual).

Imagine large numbers of people limit energy use, how likely reduce climate change
To help us improve our questions in the future, here are some questions which are similar to previous ones. Please don't try to remember what you answered before but treat them as if they were completely new questions.

Now imagine that large numbers of people limited their energy use. How likely do you think it is that this would reduce climate change?
description: Perceived impact of reduced energy use

notes: Removed question-development preface and card/interviewer instructions. Collapsed 11-point (0–10) likelihood scale into 5 categories: 0–1 Not at all likely, 2–3 Not likely, 4–6 Somewhat likely, 7–8 Very likely, 9–10 Extremely likely. Retained original special codes.

question_text_raw:
Agreed to be recontacted
Thank you for taking part in this survey today – we really appreciate you giving your time.
The European Social Survey may want to contact you again to invite you to take part in further research on similar topics to those covered by the questions I asked today. This would involve contacting you by email, SMS or post and inviting you to complete another survey. You don't need to agree now to complete another survey – just say whether you would be happy to be contacted again.
Do you agree that we may retain your name and contact details so that you can be re-contacted with invitations to take part in further research?
INTERVIEWER: Further details on this are included in the participant information leaflet given to the respondent before taking part in this interview. Please refer them to this.
question_cleaned: Do you agree that we may retain your name and contact details so we can contact you again with invitations to take part in further research?
notes: Removed thank-you text, explanatory preamble and interviewer/leaflet instructions; rephrased as a direct question.
